title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 3,175.35 USD/T on January 23, 2026, marking a 1.10% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 7.39%, and are up 20.42% compared to the same time last year. The data was last updated on January 24, 2026, reflecting ongoing upward trends in the benchmark market.

title: Final Thoughts - Steel Market Update
summary: The article discusses recent market developments, including President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on Canadian exports, with specific mention of S232 tariffs on Canadian aluminum now at 50%. It notes that unlike steel, where imports are down, aluminum market dynamics are highlighted in ongoing trade discussions. This reflects continued pressures on aluminum pricing and supply chains.

title: Alcoa (AA) Projects Increased Alumina and Aluminum Production for 2026
summary: Alcoa plans to increase Alumina production to 9.7-9.9 million metric tons and Aluminum production to 2.4-2.6 million metric tons by 2026, driven by enhanced productivity and smelter restarts. Shipments are expected to rise accordingly, though Q1 2026 faces operational challenges impacting Adjusted EBITDA by up to $100 million combined. The company notes strong institutional ownership amid sector risks like commodity price fluctuations.

title: Alcoa Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
summary: Alcoa reported Q4 and full-year 2025 results, projecting 2026 Aluminum segment production at 2.4-2.6 million metric tons, up from 2025 levels due to smelter restarts. This guidance highlights operational improvements in the aluminum business.

title: Column: US aluminum consumers pay the spiraling cost of tariffs
summary: US aluminum buyers face a 68% premium over LME prices due to tariffs, with domestic production boosted only modestly by Century Aluminum restarting 50,000 tons at Mt. Holly. US inventories have shrunk to below 300,000 tons, signaling need for more supply amid global shifts like China's near-peak output and Russian import curbs. Smelter margins remain profitable despite alumina price drops.

title: Will Strong 2025 Results and Record Output Shift Alcoa's (AA) Long-Term Investment Narrative?
summary: Alcoa reported strong 2025 results with $12.8 billion sales, $1.17 billion net income, record smelter output, and guidance for higher 2026 alumina and aluminum volumes. Progress includes San Ciprián restart and low-carbon tech like ELYSIS. These gains support a narrative of improved efficiency amid cyclical risks.

title: Alcoa sees FY25 alumina production 9.7M-9.9M mt
summary: Alcoa expects 2026 Alumina segment production between 9.7 and 9.9 million metric tons. This projection aligns with recent earnings guidance on output growth.

title: Technologies for a Sustainable Aluminium Industry in Europe
summary: This Innovation Agenda outlines key technologies, research priorities, and enabling conditions to advance low-carbon aluminium production routes and improve resource efficiency in Europe. Aluminium is vital for clean energy technologies and sectors like automotive, construction, and aerospace. It emphasizes rapid deployment of new production technologies to meet growing demand for low-carbon, circular, and securely sourced aluminium.

title: European aluminium recycling boosted with RecAL project
summary: The EU-funded RecAL project, led by the Austrian Institute of Technology, develops aluminium recycling technologies and a digital platform to promote a circular economy. It integrates 14 technological solutions up to TRL 6 into a digital ecosystem called the RecAL Hub. The initiative exploits aluminium recycling's potential, which uses only 5% of the energy for primary production, aligning with the European Green Deal.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: The ALUMINIUM 2026 event focuses on sustainability, emphasizing secondary aluminium for decarbonisation, alongside topics like metal processing, recycling, and applications in mobility and construction. Supported by Aluminium Deutschland and European Aluminium, it serves as a platform for innovation, networking, and business. Organizers highlight aluminium's recyclability as a driver for industry transformation.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
summary: Phinergy’s aluminium-air backup solution has been selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub from over 70 proposals to replace diesel generators in data centers. The hub, including Google, Microsoft, and others, will collaborate with Phinergy to scale the technology to MW levels for deployment. This advances clean, scalable backup energy for net-zero data center operations.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,129 CNY/T on January 23, 2026, marking a 0.68% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 1.43%, though they remain 5.38% lower than a year ago. Recent news highlights steel rebar futures steadying near five-month highs due to China's record December exports ahead of 2026 export license requirements.

title: Steel Prices in the Fourth Week of January 2026
summary: In the flat steel segment, prices of Russian hot-rolled coils (FOB) remained stable at $445–450 per ton. Cold-rolled coils (1 mm) from Russia also held steady. This reflects ongoing market stability in key flat steel products during the period.

title: SHFE Adjusts Steel-Related Trading Rules
summary: The Shanghai Futures Exchange (SHFE) issued a notice stating that, after research and decision, starting from the settlement after market close on Tuesday, January 27, 2026, the price limit for certain steel contracts will be adjusted. This change aims to manage volatility in ferrous metals trading. It impacts market participants ahead of the specified date.

title: Industry Data - American Iron and Steel Institute
summary: Domestic raw steel production in the US reached 1,756,000 net tons for the week ending January 17, 2026, with a capability utilization rate of 75.9 percent. This data is estimated from weekly reports covering about 50% of domestic production capacity and is used primarily to assess production trends. The figures are compiled alongside recent monthly data for a comprehensive view.

title: Global steel industry battles surplus supply, protectionism
summary: Global steelmaking capacity is projected to reach 2.55 billion metric tons by end-2025, with a surplus of 680 million mt, driven by additions in Asia and the Middle East. India anticipates producing an additional 11.4 million mt of crude steel in 2026, while excess supply pressures prices amid protectionist measures like US tariffs rising to 50%. South Korea's steelmakers plan a new 2.7 million mt/year plant in the US by 2029.

title: Turkish basic metal manufacturing capacity use down in Jan 2026 from Dec
summary: Turkey's basic metal manufacturing industry saw its capacity utilization rate drop to 75.6 percent in January 2026 from 75.8 percent in December and 76.1 percent in January 2025. The manufacture of metal products, excluding machinery and equipment, was at 74.0 percent, down slightly from December but up from last year. Overall manufacturing capacity utilization stood at 74.1 percent.

title: According to the American Iron and Steel Institute (AISI), US
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 17, 2026, totaled 1.756 million tons, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute. This figure aligns with recent industry data highlighting production trends and capacity utilization in the US steel sector.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturers are advancing green steel production through innovations like electric arc mini-mills that recycle steel scrap and reduce reliance on coal. Companies like Hertha Metals and Electra are developing coal-free processes that are more energy-efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods, with U.S. producers reducing carbon emissions by 37 percent per ton since 1990.

title: Latest News & Updates | ResponsibleSteel
summary: ResponsibleSteel hosted a policy convening in Delhi to address steel industry sustainability, highlighting hydrogen-based pilots, renewable energy integration, and scrap-based production as key developments. The organization emphasizes the need for global alignment on steel decarbonization standards while acknowledging barriers such as high green hydrogen costs and limited clean energy access.

title: Innovation and Sustainability Define Top Stainless Steel Manufacturer
summary: A leading stainless steel manufacturer in Tianjin, China is prioritizing innovation and sustainability in its operations. The article highlights how the company is integrating advanced technologies and sustainable practices into its production processes.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Copper prices hit a record high to begin 2026, opening at $6.01 per pound amid strong demand from data centers and renewable energy outpacing supply due to mining disruptions. There were 27 price increases for copper wire year-to-date. Analysts expect short-term volatility from weak Chinese demand but long-term rises toward $7 per pound.

title: Viewpoint: US copper faces uncertain 2026 outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts copper prices averaging $5.17/lb in 2026, up from $4.82/lb in 2025, amid narrowing surpluses. Citigroup predicts prices above $5.90/lb by Q2 2026, while Bank of America and TD Cowen also raised forecasts. The copper market saw a 94,000t surplus in the first three quarters of 2025.

title: Commodity Radar: After a 62% surge in 2025, copper's flat trade shows loss of momentum in 2026
summary: Copper prices stalled in early 2026 after a 62% rally in 2025 on MCX, with domestic prices falling to Rs 1,288.90/kg amid profit booking and volatility. Despite flat trade, fundamentals like supply deficits and demand from AI and green energy remain positive. Technical support holds at Rs 1,230-1,250, with analysts maintaining a bullish outlook.

title: Copper price rallies back above $13,000 on supply worries
summary: Copper surged over 3% to $13,173.50/t on the LME, a one-week high, driven by long-term supply concerns amid exploding AI demand and investor shifts to hard assets. US critical minerals status and potential tariffs under Trump add upward pressure. Year-to-date in 2026, prices have risen more than 6%.

title: Copper hits one-week high amid weak dollar, tin at record high
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the LME gained 3.2% to $13,164 per metric ton, hitting a one-week high supported by a weak dollar. The rally reflects ongoing supply worries and strong industrial demand. Tin also reached a record high in the same session.

title: Lundin Mining Announces 2025 Production Results and 2026 Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining beat original copper production guidance for 2025 and provided three-year production forecasts. Copper production is expected to remain stable at approximately 310,000-335,000 tonnes annually in 2026, with increases of 20,000 tonnes projected for 2027 following mine sequencing optimizations.

title: Copper Record High: Supply Disruptions, US Tariff Fears Shape 2026 Market
summary: LME copper hit an all-time high above $13,300/tonne as supply disruptions in Chile and Ecuador combined with US tariff uncertainty tightened the market. Strikes at major mines like Capstone Copper's Mantoverde and delays at Ecuador's Mirador project are driving concerns about global copper availability.

title: Japanese Copper Smelters Still in Talks for 2026 Charges with Miners
summary: Japanese copper smelters are negotiating 2026 treatment and refining charges with global miners, seeking terms different from those set by China. The negotiations are challenging as smelting capacity expands faster than mined supply, with some miners and smelters agreeing to $0 per metric ton charges.

title: Chile Copper Supply Gains Seen Years Away, Mining Council Warns
summary: Chile's Mining Council warns that while the country has the project pipeline to increase annual copper production to 7 million metric tons from 5.4 million tons, meaningful production increases will take years to materialize. Large producers are already operating at or near capacity, limiting short-term supply gains.

title: Substantial Shortfall in Copper Supply Widens as AI and Defense Spending Add to Demand
summary: An S&P Global study projects that global copper production will peak in 2030 at 33 million metric tons, with a supply deficit reaching 10 million metric tons by 2040 as demand surges 50%. The copper sector faces challenges including declining ore grades, rising costs, and lengthy permitting processes that average 17 years for new mines.

title: Teck Resources Reports 2025 Sales & Production Performance
summary: Teck Resources produced 435,500 tons of copper in 2025, within its guidance range of 415,000-465,000 tons. In the fourth quarter of 2025 alone, the company produced 134,100 tons of copper, driven by solid performance across all assets.

title: Driving innovation at Escondida
summary: BHP highlights innovations at its Escondida copper mine in Chile, the world’s largest producer, where the Escondida Norte pit is now fully autonomous with 33 trucks and 11 drills operating seamlessly. This has enabled 30% of production from the autonomous zone, moving over 350,000 tonnes daily while enhancing safety, efficiency, and sustainability. Over 5,000 workers have been trained, with 64% female participation in autonomy roles.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) partners with Rio Tinto to source low-carbon copper produced via Nuton technology for U.S. data centers, using microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores without traditional smelters. The collaboration leverages AWS's cloud analytics to optimize acid/water use, improve recovery, and reduce emissions and water intensity. This aims to support sustainable supply chains amid rising copper demand from AI and cloud computing.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto announces a collaboration with Amazon Web Services to supply low-carbon Nuton copper for U.S. data centers, focusing on innovative extraction that reduces the mine-to-market chain and emissions. Nuton technology produces high-purity copper cathode directly at the mine using bioleaching. The partnership emphasizes sustainability in meeting copper demand driven by digital infrastructure.

title: Zijin Joins International Copper Association to Advance Sustainable Development
summary: Zijin Mining, the world’s fourth-largest copper producer, joined the International Copper Association on January 1, 2026, via its subsidiary Gold Mountains to promote sustainable copper production and innovation. The membership strengthens global collaboration for responsible mining, technological advancement, and copper’s role in the energy transition. Zijin commits to green practices and industry synergy for a resilient supply chain.

title: Gold Mountains, subsidiary of Zijin Mining Group, Officially Joins the International Copper Association to Deepen Sustainable Collaboration Across the Global Copper Value Chain
summary: Gold Mountains, a Zijin Mining subsidiary, joins the International Copper Association to enhance sustainable collaboration in the copper industry, leveraging strengths in innovation and green operations. The move supports responsible production amid rising global demand for energy transition materials. It fosters technical exchange and best practices for a resilient copper ecosystem.

title: Critical battery minerals market outlook for Jan 2026 - Policy shifts and supply dynamics
summary: LME 3M nickel price rose 10% to a high of US$18,735/tonne, the highest since June 2024, driven by expectations of tightening nickel ore supply in Indonesia. SHFE nickel prices surged over Yuan 15,000/tonne in the week after December 19, exceeding Yuan 130,000/tonne, and hit Yuan 147,720/tonne on January 7. Nickel sulfate prices rebounded to Yuan 27,300/tonne by end-December 2025 and are projected to average Yuan 29,800-30,400/tonne in January 2026 amid cost support.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel rose to 18,710 USD/T on January 23, 2026, up 3.37% from the previous day, with a 19.48% monthly gain. Futures fell to around $17,800 per tonne after a high of $18,700, due to profit-taking and softening Chinese demand, where spot prices dropped 3,450 yuan per tonne. Nickel futures rebounded to $17,900 per tonne on improving demand from Chinese stainless steel mills and EV battery producers.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices jumped to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026, the highest in over two years, soaring over $4,000 per tonne in four weeks to above US$18,000/tonne. Indonesia is delaying mining permits and slashing nickel output quotas to support prices, with only 55% of 2025 approved capacity utilized, deflating the paper surplus. Prices could test US$25,000 per tonne but a more defensible range is US$20,000–$22,000/t amid tightening physical balances.

title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
summary: Nickel prices spiked over 10% in London to a high of $18,785 a ton on the LME, the biggest gain in over three years, driven by surging Chinese investor interest and mounting risks to Indonesian production. This extends a 30% rise since mid-December despite oversupply, marking a reversal from excess output and weak EV battery demand. Trading dynamics show Chinese influence with high-volume rallies during Asian hours.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] Refined high-grade NPI prices set to rise further next week
summary: Refined nickel prices continued rising, with the most-traded SHFE nickel contract (2602) closing at 148,010 yuan/mt on Friday, up 2.52% week-on-week, hitting a weekly high of 150,000 yuan/mt. The LME nickel 3M contract also advanced amid the rally.

title: Indonesia cuts 2026 nickel quota, global prices jump immediately
summary: Indonesia cut its 2026 nickel quota, leading to immediate strengthening of nickel prices on the LME and Asian exchanges due to growing concerns over tighter supply.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for lithium-ion batteries in EVs and green energy. The project uses the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste, making it a carbon-negative facility. It supports sustainable supply chains with partnerships like GM securing nickel and cobalt production options.

title: CATL and the Ellen Macarthur Foundation Set Direction for Circular EV Batteries with Landmark Whitepaper
summary: CATL collaborates with the Ellen MacArthur Foundation on a whitepaper outlining circular economy principles for EV batteries, achieving 99.6% recovery rates for nickel, cobalt, and manganese. The approach reduces demand for virgin materials, lowers emissions, and supports supply chain resilience through high-quality recycling at scale. It aligns with CATL's carbon neutrality goals and promotes alternative chemistries like sodium-ion batteries.

title: Greener method recovers critical metals from spent batteries
summary: Researchers at Monash University developed a mild deep eutectic solvent (DES) process to recover over 95% of high-purity nickel, cobalt, manganese, and lithium from spent lithium-ion batteries, including complex black mass. This sustainable method avoids high temperatures and hazardous chemicals, offering a safer alternative for recycling and advancing a circular economy for critical metals. It also shows potential for recovering metals from electronic waste and mine tailings.
